wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General The Honourable Sir Thomas Patrick John Boyd-Carpenter  (born 16 June 1938) is a former British Army officer who became Deputy Chief of the Defence Staff (Programmes and Personnel).

link_mentions.page: Deputy Chief of the Defence Staff
response: *1992 – 1996 Lieutenant-General the Hon. Sir Thomas Boyd-Carpenter

In 1937, Boyd-Carpenter married Margaret ("Peggy") Mary, daughter of Lieutenant-Colonel George Leslie Hall, OBE, of the Royal Engineers.Burke's Peerage, Baronetage and Knightage, 107th edition, ed. Charles Mosley, Burke's Peerage Ltd, 2003, p. 471 Boyd-Carpenter's son, Thomas Boyd-Carpenter, was himself knighted following his military and public service careers. One of his two daughters, Sarah Hogg, Baroness Hogg, married Douglas Hogg, 3rd Viscount Hailsham, and is a life peer in her own right.
*Sir Thomas Boyd-Carpenter KBE (1995-2004)Department for Work and Pensions - Social Security Advisory Committee publishes seventeenth report
